private_information: I can move only disks A, B, C, D, E.
I cannot move disks F, G, H, I, J.
I must always obey Tower of Hanoi rules: move only the top disk, and never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.
agent_1.goal: Cooperate to reach the goal state where the left peg has (top→bottom) C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J; the middle peg has (top→bottom) A, B; the right peg is empty.

private_information: I can move only disks F, G, H, I, J.
I cannot move disks A, B, C, D, E.
I must always obey Tower of Hanoi rules: move only the top disk, and never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.
agent_2.goal: Cooperate to reach the goal state where the left peg has (top→bottom) C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J; the middle peg has (top→bottom) A, B; the right peg is empty.

private_information: I audit temporal and causal consistency of proposed moves.
I ensure that every move picks a top disk from its current support and places it on a legal target (empty peg or a larger top disk).
I remove bookkeeping shortcuts and non-causal placeholders, and I reject plans that require moves by an agent not authorized for the disk in question.
auditor.goal: Verify and, if needed, correct and finalize an ordered list of primitive moves that achieves the specified goal exactly, without extraneous or illegal steps.

private_information: I coordinate agents, integrate the audited plan, and produce a final PDDL domain and problem tailored for the Fast Downward solver.
I encode agent capability constraints so that only agent_1 can move A–E and only agent_2 can move F–J.
orchestrator.goal: Produce the final ordered list of primitive moves and a valid PDDL domain and problem for Fast Downward capturing this exact 2-agent Tower of Hanoi instance.

public_information: Task: Cooperative 2-agent Tower of Hanoi with 10 disks labeled A (smallest) through J (largest).
Agents and permissions: agent_1 may move disks A, B, C, D, E; agent_2 may move disks F, G, H, I, J.
Initial configuration: left peg has (top→bottom) A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J; middle peg is empty; right peg is empty.
Goal configuration: left peg has (top→bottom) C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J; middle peg has (top→bottom) A, B; right peg is empty.
Rules: move exactly one disk at a time; only the top disk may be moved; never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.
Ordered list of primitive moves that achieves the goal:
1. agent_1: move disk A from left to right
2. agent_1: move disk B from left to middle
3. agent_1: move disk A from right to middle
No moves by agent_2 are required for this instance because only disks A and B must be repositioned.

primitive_moves: agent_1: move disk A from left to right
agent_1: move disk B from left to middle
agent_1: move disk A from right to middle
solution.remarks: All moves comply with agent permissions and Tower of Hanoi rules. Final state matches the specified goal; right peg is empty.

propose_moves.system_prompt: You propose concrete primitive moves for disks you are authorized to move (A–E) to help achieve the target arrangement. Do not emit PDDL.
propose_moves.prompt: Your name is agent_1. Public information describes the puzzle, rules, and the target arrangement: {environment->public_information}. Your private knowledge and constraints: {agents->agent_1->private_information}. Your goal: {agents->agent_1->goal}. Propose a minimal ordered list of primitive moves you can perform, in the format agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2, that contributes directly to the goal and respects all rules.

propose_moves.system_prompt: You propose concrete primitive moves only for disks you are authorized to move (F–J). Do not emit PDDL.
propose_moves.prompt: Your name is agent_2. Public information describes the puzzle, rules, and the target arrangement: {environment->public_information}. Your private knowledge and constraints: {agents->agent_2->private_information}. Your goal: {agents->agent_2->goal}. If necessary, propose an ordered list of primitive moves you can perform, in the format agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2, that respects all rules and helps reach the goal. If no moves are necessary, state that clearly.

audit.system_prompt: You audit temporal and causal consistency. Remove bookkeeping shortcuts and reject illegal or unauthorized moves. Ensure the sequence is sufficient and minimal for the stated goal.
audit.prompt: You receive proposed moves from agent_1 and agent_2. Verify that each move manipulates only a top disk, respects disk size constraints, and adheres to agent permissions. Produce a single, final ordered list of primitive moves that achieves the goal exactly in the format agent_i: move disk X from peg1 to peg2. If a proposal is extraneous or violates rules, correct it.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in PDDL targeting the Fast Downward solver. You must produce a valid PDDL domain and a matching PDDL problem that exactly capture this Tower of Hanoi instance and agent capability constraints. Always enclose the domain between <domain></domain> and the problem between <problem></problem>.
pddl.prompt: Integrate the audited plan: {audited_plan}. Use the public information about objects, initial state, and goal: {environment->public_information} and the initialization details: {environment->init}. Produce a PDDL domain and problem suitable for Fast Downward. Include types for agents, disks, and pegs. Encode predicates: on(disk, place), clear(place), smaller(disk, disk), can-move(agent, disk). Provide two actions, move_to_peg and move_to_disk, parameterized by an agent, that require can-move(agent, disk) and enforce size and top-of-stack constraints using clear(x). The initial state must reflect the full left-peg stack A on B on C on ... on J on left, with middle and right clear and only A clear among disks. The goal must encode A on B and B on middle; C on D on ... on J on left; right clear. Ensure syntax is compatible with Fast Downward (use :strips and :typing and avoid quantified preconditions). Enclose the PDDL domain in <domain></domain> and the PDDL problem in <problem></problem>.
